moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6: A quiet beginning to a game full of fireworks.
moves.5... Ne4 6. Bxe7 Qxe7: Already Black has cleared the way for King-side castling... although he doesn't actually do it for a while.
moves.7. Nxe4 dxe4 8. Qe2: Spielmann now threatens to win the advanced Black Pawn, and he makes way for Queen-side castling.
moves.8... Nd7 9. O-O-O: Games where the players castle on opposite wings can lead to tremendous fireworks -- as is the case here.
moves.9... f5 10. exf6 e.p. Nxf6: Black declares that he will attack as well.
moves.11. g3 O-O 12. Bg2: Applying further pressure to the advanced Pawn.
moves.12... e5 13. Bxe4: Spielmann thinks he will be up a Pawn after the exchanges...
moves.16... Bf5: ...and Black counters aggressively. No passive retreat for him!
moves.17. Qxb7: Spielmann thinks this move wins for him. What he didn't see is that 17 QxNP??? can be countered with 17... RxPch! 18 K-N1 [forced] R-B8 dbl ch!!! with a devastating attack. A tremendous rarity to have such an attacking master as Spielmann miss a simple, crushing combination for his opponent.
moves.17... Rxc2+ 18. Kb1 Rc1+: His opponent didn't miss the opportunity. Spielmann's King is now doomed.
moves.20. Kd2 Qd3+ 21. Ke1 Qe3+: Preparing for the final blow, the unstoppable move ...R-KB1. Spielmann can do nothing about this.
moves.22. Kf1 Rf8: Black threatens 23...B-R6 mate, and if Spielmann tries 23 Q-N3 ch, 23... B-K3 dis ch! is decisive. So Spielmann throws in the towel. A tremendous attacking game by Black.
